contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary|killing time}} '''Killing Time''' may refer to: * [[The Killing Time]], a period in late 17th century Scottish history {{TOC right}} == Film == * [[Killing Time (1984 film)|''Killing Time'' (1984 film)]], nominated for a [[BAFTA Award for Best Short Film#1980s|BAFTA Award for Best Short Film]] * [[The Killing Time (film)|''The Killing Time'' (film)]], a 1987 film starring Kiefer Sutherland * [[Killing Time (1995 film)|''Killing Time'' (1995 film)]], a short movie by [[Damian Harris]] starring Eric Stoltz * [[Killing Time (1998 film)|''Killing Time'' (1998 film)]], a British film by Bharat Nalluri * [[Killing Time (2007 film)|''Killing Time'' (2007 film)]], a documentary by Annika Gustafson about the Bhutanese refugees == Literature == === Fiction === * [[Killing Time (Carr novel)|''Killing Time'' (Carr novel)]], a 2000 novel by Caleb Carr * [[Killing Time (Star Trek novel)|''Killing Time'' (Star Trek novel)]], a 1985 ''Star Trek: The Original Series'' novel by Della van Hise * ''Killing Time'', a 1961 novel by [[Donald Westlake]] * ''Killing Time'', a 1967 novel by [[Thomas Berger (novelist)|Thomas Berger]] * ''Killing Time'', a 1996 Bill Slider mystery by [[Cynthia Harrod-Eagles]] * ''Killing Time'', a 2005 novel by [[Linda Howard]] * ''Killing Time'', a 2003 novel in the series [[The Invisible Detective]] by Justin Richards * ''Killing Time'', a 1988 novel by [[Robert J. Conley]] === Non fiction === * [[Killing Time (book)|''Killing Time'' (book)]], a 1994 autobiography by Paul Feyerabend * ''Killing Time: Life in the Arkansas Penitentiary'', a 1977 photography book by [[Bruce Jackson (scholar)|Bruce Jackson]] * ''Killing Time: The First Full Investigation into the Unsolved Murders of Nicole Brown Simpson and Ronald Goldman'', a 1996 book by [[Donald Freed]] and Raymond P. Briggs * ''Killing Time: An Investigation into the Death-Row Case of Mumia Abu-Jamal'', a 2003 book by [[Dave Lindorff]] * ''Killing Time: Archaeology and the First World War'', a 2007 book by [[Nicholas J. Saunders]] === Poetry === * ''Killing Time'', a 1999 poetry collection by [[Simon Armitage]] == Music == ===Albums=== * [[Killing Time (Bayside album)|''Killing Time'' (Bayside album)]], 2011 * [[Killing Time (Girl album)|''Killing Time'' (Girl album)]], 1987 * [[Killing Time (Massacre album)|''Killing Time'' (Massacre album)]], 1981 * [[Killing Time (Tina Cousins album)|''Killing Time'' (Tina Cousins album)]], 1998 * [[Killing Time (Infected Mushroom EP)|"Killing Time" (Infected Mushroom EP)]], 2010 * ''Killing Time'', an album by [[Sweet Savage]], or the title song, also covered by Metallica ===Songs=== * "Killing Time", a song by Destiny's Child from ''[[Destiny's Child (album)|Destiny's Child]]'' * "Killing Time", a song by Grave Digger from ''[[Tunes of War]]'' * "Killing Time", a song by Joss Stone from ''[[Mind Body & Soul]]'' * "Killing Time", a song by Hed PE from ''[[Broke (album)|Broke]]'' * "Killing Time", a song by Hollywood Rose from ''[[The Roots of Guns N' Roses]]'' * "Killing Time", a song by Obituary from ''[[The End Complete]]'' * "Killing Time", a song by Pennywise from ''[[About Time (Pennywise album)|About Time]]'' * "Killing Time", a song by Triumph from ''[[Thunder Seven]]'' ===Musicians=== * [[Killing Time (American band)]], an American hardcore punk band * [[Killing Time (Australian band)]], now known as Mantissa, an Australian heavy-rock band == Television == * [[Killing Time (TV series)|''Killing Time'' (TV series)]], a 2011 Australian TV drama series * [[Killing Time (Beavis and Butt-head)|"Killing Time" (''Beavis and Butt-head'')]], an episode of ''Beavis and Butt-head'' * [[Killing Time (Time Squad)|"Killing Time" (''Time Squad'')]], an episode of ''Time Squad'' == Other media == * [[Killing Time (video game)|''Killing Time'' (video game)]], a 1995 first-person shooter originally for 3DO * ''Killing Time'', a video artwork by [[Sam Taylor-Wood]] ==See also== * [[Killin' Time (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation}}
